revised_title: Experimental Investigation of Sodium-Deuteron Transmutation and Nuclear Masses
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the transmutation of sodium under bombardment with deuterons. They found two groups of alpha-particles emitted, which led to the formation of an isotope of sodium and an excitation level in the 21Ne nucleus. They also discovered four groups of protons emitted, which indicated the presence of excitation levels in the 24Na nucleus. The authors determined the masses of 23Na, 24Na, and 24Mg from their observations.
